Dr. Seshiah's commitment to ethical practice would be unwavering. Given his focus on general medicine, Dr. Seshiah likely possesses a strong commitment to preventive care. Innovation in general medicine, while often subtle, lies in the effective integration of new knowledge and technologies into established practices. His practice ethics would be guided by principles of beneficence (acting in the patient's best interest), non-maleficence (avoiding harm), autonomy (respecting patient's decisions), and justice (fair distribution of healthcare resources).
